result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stallone L McAdory

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stallone L McAdory appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz appeared by video for Stallone L McAdory.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed on this case and requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. 

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with DAL (DOB: 11/11/1988);
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Stallone L McAdory appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Alexander Kostal appeared by video for Stallone L McAdory. Prosecuting attorney Peter Cannon in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
